reviewText:
This is actually a funner game than I thought it would be. Here's a list of pros and cons!

Pros:
-Simple and Fun game
-Good level structure
-A bit of challenge

Cons:
-Some of the white blocks blend in with the back ground which makes it hard to see where to land or go.
-Some of the parts of some levels take a longer time and get quite frustrating.

Other wise, this is a cheap and a fun game. Definitely worth your 50¢!

-Note to author

Congrats on your first game! It's great to see that a simple game like this that actually fun. I'd rather play this than some very buggy and broken game. Keep up with your good work!

reviewText:
Continuing a series of games knocked-up in Unity from a basic how to make a character jump" tutorial and then "inspired" by Super Meat Boy and given a "hip" name to disguise it's utter lack of originality (or commercial viability)

2 points if I may...

1 - Namechecking Super Meat Boy "because your game is hard" only works if it's "hard but fair always feels like deaths are your fault" and not just "hard because the controls are crap and you don't explain anything"

2 - Namechecking "Free Flash Games" is ironic given they were free and generally better than this - which costs money and so - erm...

Honestly..."

reviewText: My emotions for this game are mixed, it was bought for me by a friend for 0.35GBP. It's an addictive little game but by God the amounts of unholy rage brought forth by playing this game will leave you broken and beat. After about 40 minutes of straight playing it i decided to take a little rest, because i was about to walk outside and punch the first person i see even if it was a little old lady in the 80's or a toddler just playing about in the street after about. After an hour i decided to have  another go at this level only to my surprise my progress was not saved then i found out there was no way to save...this drove me insane. After bringing myself to play a little more i got stuck on one of the simple levels to complete this was the end for me. But all that aside cool little rage game to make you want to punch toddlers 10/10

reviewText:
This game has one BIG ISSUE.

The blending of colors and not being opposites. I am colorblind, and I was consistently confused with the textures in the game. This resulted in many deaths.

Not only that, but the terrible music which just loops every 30 seconds is very dull. Mute the game and listen to some YouTube video featuring any of Beethoven's music and you'll get the same thing.

Lastly, the platforming and gameplay is very dull. I found the gravity to be very uncomfortable.

reviewText: Super Hipster Lumberjack is pretty simple, theres no real objective other than running around and trying to complete the level. This being said, it does offer up a great degree of difficulty considering I could hardly get passed the third level before I decided it was just to hard for me. However, that's not neccesarily a bad thing, the games difficulty turns what would be a rather short game into a seemingly impossible journey. I loved the little bits of physics based gameplay here and there but I often felt like I spent far to much time trying to get them down, but maybe that's just me. Lastly, the games soundtrack is very amusing and honestly I'd rather just listen to the music then play the game.\n\nOverall good game considering the price but it's more of a turn-your-brain-off kinda game,

reviewText:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=695657772

While looking over the reviews before purchasing this game, I couldn't understand how the opinions of Super Hipster Lumberjack could be so polar, but after playing the game first-hand I completely understand.

On the surface, this  game has pretty much everything I want in an Indie platformer. Uncommon visuals with a steady curb of difficulty without being disproportionately hard at times. That's really all I ask for from this game, pretty simple, but the issue I have is that its not really a game" at all.

I'm thrown into a world without context or meaning. No story to drive me
date: and no reason why I should leave the 90's 2D paradise that is my room. I would be perfectly content there honestly
recommended: but I suppose that would make for an even more lack-luster game. Even a single speech bubble would be nice
hoursPlayed: or a booming voice telling me to go right would do this game a lot of good. But no dice.\n\nThe mechanics are pretty solid
voteText: and even though this "game" doesn't quit bring anything new to the table
helpfulPercent: its worth the low price tag for some cheap (good) rage
votesTotal: I recommend this as long as you have the right expectations going into it."

reviewText:

reviewText:
For a first time development project, this isn't bad. But at the risk of sounding like a jerk, I don't think it's good enough to sell, even at such a low price. Based on the Steam page I had been expecting a very basic platformer, but I was also hoping for a quirky sense of humour, some kind of story, an interesting gimmick or two, or at least some kind of art design to justify the title and to brighten up the blocks we're jumping over. There is some fun here - it's a good start and I look forward to what comes next - but I dont recommend this one. It feels very bare bones, more like a practice assignment than a finished product.

Pros-
Addictive 'rage game' quality. Some fun level design.

Cons-
Not very precise in its control or hitboxes, no story or style, backgrounds are mostly just coloured shapes, music is a collection of MIDI versions of classical tunes, no sound effects at all and very few animations (death for example is just an instant reset).

reviewText:
Pros:
~ Fitting Music
~ Its cheap as ♥♥♥♥ £0.32

Cons:
~ Poor art-style which clashes with the backround
~ Buggy (falling out the map when you're almost finished the level isnt fun)
~ Music is repetitive as ♥♥♥♥
~ More of a personal thing, but if Noah (the protagonist) is a game designer which gets absorbed into his own game, why is the game called Super Hipster Lumberjack? I mean yeah, he's got the steriotypical lumberjack attire, and I DID see a tree at some point, but...
~ Not very hard, but checkpoints are few and far between

In my opinion, the graphics/artstyle is the biggest killer of this game. No one expects platformers to have crysis 3 next gen PC master race MLG graphics, but I do expect something to look nice. The best looking part of the game is the Super Hipster Lumberjacks bedroom at the start of the game, and the tree that I mentioned earlier.

reviewText: Super Hipster Lumberjack is an amazing representation of what can happen when people put their differences aside and work together. reviewText:
This game was developed by a high-schooler. Nothing wrong with that necissarily, but it does show. Super Hipster Lumberjack is decent. Not atrocious, but altogether not terribly memorable.

The Good:
-I like the visual style.
-Simple gameplay

The Bad:
-I can't tell if this is a rage game or if the jump is just poorly done
-The music loops get really old. Fast.
-No sound FX. This can work if there's good enough bg music, but as stated before, there isn't really.
-No checkpoints on points that could really use them (Or maybe it's a rage game)

Honestly, the biggest problem with this game is it isn't all that memorable, and lacks polish. However, if you want to help support and indie developer then go ahead and buy it, I mean, It's only 50 cents.

6/10

EDIT:
Ok, so I read the desc. (Probably should have done that in the first place) And this is supposed to be a homage to difficult games, so I suppose some factors are justified. Still, the jump feels a little cheaty, and the controls could be improved. Overall, just not a whole lot a replay value, but for a first game I guess that's ok.

reviewText:
I bought this game because i thought it had character. perhaps it would have been a self aware game, or something comical.

It is not.

this game is not my cup of tea.

it tries to be a rage game (restarts you at the start when you die, no saves, hazards everywhere) but it lacks what most rage games have...some sort of rewardment for players.



perhaps the reward is the story & characters in the game?

Doesnt have that. You play as a 2D sprite of a man(?) in a flannel shirt. thats pretty much it.



the background is unique and pretty?

Nope. Its a 2D/3D enviroment consisting of white background, white blocks to jump on, and the blocks are sometimes other colors...sometimes.


the game have any sort of progression?

No. you jump on blocks. that is it.


is it anything that a game should be?

no. you would probably get more enjoyment out of a flash game on the internet.

reviewText: How I Found This Game\n\nWhile selling a few crappy CS:GO skins, I made about 60 cents. As always when I have a few cents, I went to Games Under $5" and sorted by lowest price. When I saw this game
date: I didn't expect it to be amazing. It was 50 freaking cents! AND IT WASN'T ON SALE! But the reviews were very positive
recommended:
so I decided to try it out.

Downloading

It takes 13 seconds to download on my crappy computer. But it's to be expected since it's so cheap and can't be huge.

Options

When you open the game
hoursPlayed: you are presented with a window that lets you edit the resolution
voteText: graphics quality
votesHelpful: and your controls. The only thing worth changing is the resolution (which you should do max
votesTotal:
it's not like it lags or anything)

Title Screen

On the title screen there's 4 things:
a New Game button
a Load Game button
a Quit Game button
a volume slider (and it stays on the screen as you play
votesFunny:
which is VERY helpful.)

Gameplay

When you first enter the game
commentsCount: you'll find out quickly that this a platformer. It has 3D visuals
column16: but it's actually just a 2D platformer. The goal is to get to the end of the level without touching anything that's dark gray. It sounds easy at first
column17: but it gets really challenging (luckily not rage inducing). Objects can launch you
column19: move back and forth between foreground and background
column20:
and block your view.

Final Thoughts

GET THIS GAME! I may not have completed it
column21: but this game is a blast! I recommend it to anybody who likes platformer games. Also
column22: it's literally 50 CENTS! That's as cheap as a good game gets! It may be the cheapest game on Steam
column23: but it's also one of the best puzzle platformer games on Steam (ONE of the best).\n\nSO YES! Overall I recommend the game!"

reviewText: Let me just start this review by saying its not a triple A title. Or even an indie game that someone spent years making. It's a 50 cent platformer game with some nice challenge and decent controls. It even has controller support! If you bother to find out more about the developer you'll find out he made this game before he even came out of High School!! For a beginner level developing game I gotta say I had fun with it. Not for hours and hours, but if you don't have time for a 3+ hour game session this game was a nice time killer. My advice? Give it a shot for not even a dollar. Better than alot of free games out there to.

reviewText: Friend gifted me this. Had no idea what it was going in, but was a little concerned when the Unity for Personal Use" splash screen popped up at the start.\n\nThe first time I moved
date:
I feel through the floor and had to press R to restart the level.

Other issues:
* I'm usually fairly lenient when it comes to art styles
recommended: but I thought this game was just really bland looking. The music was okay
hoursPlayed: but it's also MIDIs of classical music
voteText: so that's to be expected.\n\n* The controls are mostly acceptable
helpfulPercent: but there were several instances where I would land on a platform
votesFunny: and the actual turn felt weirdly stiff
commentsCount: which would throw me off and make me miss the jump. I wouldn't be surprised to find out this runs on a pre-built sample platformer engine.\n\n* Jumping at the corner of a platform is apparently as good as landing on top of it
column16: since you get dragged on top of it anyway.\n\n* There are piston platforms that you're meant to jump off with the right timing so you can be launched higher into the air. I'm not usually good at that sort of thing
column17: but it felt especially difficult to pull off here
column18:
not helped by me being launched up with seemingly random force.

* I think there's supposed to be a cutscene at the start that's broken and immediately skips itself.

* The levels feel long given the lack of checkpoints.

If you want a difficult platformer for cheap that has a "retro" aesthetic
column19: go grab You Have to Win the Game. It's free and the art style actually makes sense. Don't spend 50 cents on this."

reviewText: This game IS worth 50 cents. This isn't some quick scheme to take your money. It's a well made and responsive game. While there is no checkpoints there are levels and are managable to play from the start over and over. This game is a ver fun platformer and never had I said while playing that a jump was unfair, just difficult. I enjoyed figuring out how to jump and learning the mechanics. This game is made by someone in high school which if this is a game he made in high school, I am VERY interesting in what he makes next! Overall, Super Hipster Lumberjack is a great game, while it doesn't have original music (8 bit classical music) and some levels you could wish for a checkpoint, it would still be worth a dollar at least.

reviewText: This game is pretty good. For 50 cents I did not know what I was getting into, but I ended up loving it. I have about an hour logged on the game and I have gotten past the first 3 levels. I dont have a controller so I couldent test if there is compatibility, but this game would be fun on a NES/SNES controller so it would be nice if the dev would add that compatibility if they didnt already. Another thing I would like to see happen is since Noah(I think thats the characters name) is a Super Hipster Lumberjack his character should have hipster glasses.  For 50 cents I strongly reccomend you buy a copy for yourself. (Also the soundtrack is pretty good.)

reviewText: Best Game 10/10. But for real its pretty good for someones first attempt at making a game. Cool gameplay mechanics and has decent graphics. Music needs a bit of work. The music in the pumpkin level is by far the worst, most ear-rapey thing ive ever heard. The rest was ok though. It seemed kind of out of place. Collision was also weird during some parts but didnt get in the way too much. I was also impressed when i discovered an easter egg (not telling where) although it was not yet complete and impossible to do anything with. The overall game was not too hard and well worth my 50 cents. :D

reviewText: Super Hipster Lumberjack is a fun and challenging platformer game that can be played as a fast paced game or slower paced for those who like to take there time. It is extremely easy to run. I have had the game for 2 days and already have almost 7 hours of play time! That shows how much I like it. I recommend this game for anyone low on funds and/or doesn't have a high end PC.
